episodes.title: Jehovah’s Witnesses and the embellished “experiences”
episodes.description:
The watchtower teaches: “There is another type of false story that we need to be on guard against. A great many sensational tales circulate.. It is wise to be cautious about such tales, especially if we do not know the original source of the information. Even if an experience or story was sent by a reputable Christian, that individual may not have firsthand knowledge of the facts. That is why it is important to be cautious about repeating or forwarding unverified accounts. We surely would not want to repeat “godless myths,” or “false stories which violate what is holy.” (1 Timothy 4:7; New International Version) Since we also have an obligation to speak truthfully to one another, we are acting wisely by avoiding anything that would cause us even unwittingly to spread untruths.​—Ephesians 4:25.” W02 9/15

And yet The organization itself promotes untruthful experiences, i saw it firsthand.

 Listen to my story and share your thoughts in comments. Have you known of experiences that were embellished or flat out lies? 



📢📢📢📢📢📢📢📢📢📢📢📢📢📢



 "My Story" of waking up as a 4th Generation Born-in Jehovah's Witness started with my Marriage and a Divorce : https://youtu.be/Im4es209-7E?si=ILKJITWjmIN8r7Kl

episodes.title: They stayed Alive till ‘75…..  that is almost FIFTY years ago.
episodes.description:
Some may remember the hype surrounding 1975 marked as the end of this system of things. People sold their homes, businesses. Kids were pulled out of school to pioneer. Those kids are now retirement aged and many have never expected to grow old in this system. 1975 didn’t come and neither did armageddon come any time in the following 50 years!
Here is my story involving 1975.

episodes.title: Jehovah’s Witnesses + unhealthy lifestyle, because you know, the End is near!
episodes.description:
Jehovah’s Witnesses are on a hamster wheel and are constantly on the go: service (a minimum of 10 hours a month in the preaching work is suggested), meetings twice a week (approx 3-4 hours here), family worship, personal study, keep up with all the literature, read your Bible daily, get dressed for meetings and service, get-togethers, special schools for pioneers and elders, go to assemblies and conventions that take up your entire weekend, the memorial, special campaigns, and then the next year you get to do it all over again. It is a cycle so draining and time consuming:

When is there time to be healthy? To prepare food, cook, and maintain healthy lifestyles? To work out? To relax? 

This is my story about how this was a struggle for myself as a Jehovah’s Witness Mom.

episodes.title: A Jehovah’s Witness story about a political group + Guns= your Bible trained conscience was wrong?
episodes.description:
This is a story of a 4th generation Jehovah’s Witness who had Bible truths deeply engrained and thought they knew right from wrong with their lifelong study of the Bible and watchtower literature: when she saw things that were not in accord to spiritual standards she wrote to the society, and the governing body. What the organization replied to her and the body of elders in regards  to politics and guns may surprise you!


“They Will Beat Their Swords Into Plowshares’—When?
A FAMOUS statue at the United Nations in New York City depicts a man beating a sword into a plowshare. It is based on the Bible prophecies of Isaiah chapter 2, verse 4, and Micah chapter 4, verse 3. How and when will these words be fulfilled?

A recent report in The New York Times carried the headline “Global Arms Sales Swell to $30 Billion”! In 1999 who were the leading suppliers of this vast array of arms? The United States led the way with sales of $11.8 billion.

 “When will the nations ever learn peace instead of war?” The Bible indicates that this turning to peace would be “in the final part of the days.” (Isaiah 2:2) In fact, this prophecy is already undergoing fulfillment, as nearly six million Jehovah’s Witnesses have allowed themselves ‘to be taught by Jehovah.’ As a consequence, their ‘peace is abundant.’—Isaiah 54:13.

Soon Jehovah will bring an end to all weapons and wars and those who promote them, for he will “bring to ruin those ruining the earth.” If you would like to know more about this wonderful change, please feel free to contact Jehovah’s Witnesses in your area or write to the appropriate address listed on page 5.—Revelation 11:18.”

G01/3/8

episodes.title: A “Worldy” Husband’s perspective of marrying a former Jehovah’s Witness
episodes.description:
I wanted to interview my Hubby in a candid interview in which he shares very deep and emotional thoughts and perspectives on what it’s like to date a person who grew up in a cult; and his outlook on life and love. He bares his soul, so proud of him! Not an easy thing to do sometimes to share so many personal things but he did it in order to maybe help others. 


✌️


I started this channel in order to tell my life story. “Waking up- My Story” as a 4th Generation born- in Jehovah’s Witness. I am sharing how i navigated leaving the JW’s, moving on and in this Episode I talk about my experience (or lack there of) of dating in the world as a single mom nonetheless. 

 There can be happiness after you leave a cult- always remember that! 💗💗💗


I hope this video can help anyone who is trying to navigate Through the challenge of leaving a cult and getting out of these entangled situations. 

💚😱🚨 "My Story" as a 4th Generation Born-in Jehovah's Witness started with my Marriage and a Divorce (previous episode: https://youtu.be/Im4es209-7E?si=ILKJITWjmIN8r7Kl )

... and then finally here I am waking up from the faith that was my own for all my life and that of my forefathers. What a shock! And all that, with kids!😵

episodes.title: Waking up- My Story-Episode 9: “Navigating the World”
episodes.description:
First of all, I’m sorry I am fighting some kind of bug so I’m not at my best but still wanted to make this video. My apologies! 


Leaving a cult is so much more than just leaving one thing. It affected us and we, especially as born-ins that have no prior experience being “worldly”, now have to find a way to assimilate and fit into the world and navigate through things, finding out what works for us and what doesn’t! Here’s our story of doing just that. 

I hope this video can help anyone who is trying to manoeuvre through the challenge of leaving a cult and getting out of these entangled situations. 

 "My Story" as a 4th Generation Born-in Jehovah's Witness continues and how we woke up. It all started with my Marriage and a Divorce (previous episode: https://youtu.be/Im4es209-7E?si=ILKJITWjmIN8r7Kl )

... and then finally here I am waking up from the faith that was my own for all my life and that of my forefathers. What a shock! And all that, with kids!

episodes.title: Waking up- My Story-Episode 7: “My Dad and the Story of how he woke up”
episodes.description:
My dad was one of the youngest elder’s in his congregation and he is the youngest of a huge family, all his siblings born in. His parents joined post-wW2, having been displaced. Never seeing home again, and here was a hope and a community: the Jehovah’s Witnesses. There could be 10 parts of the story of my Dad and his life as a JW but this is mainly the story of how he woke up and got out. 


I hope this video can help anyone who is trying to navigate Through the challenge of leaving a cult and getting out of these entangled situations.

episodes.description:
In Episode 11 of “Who The Heck Did I Marry? JW Edition” -“the Funeral”- I tell the story of the madness surrounding my sweet and kind grandpa’s passing and his memorial service at the Kingdom Hall. 
Jehovah’s witnesses are taught that they will not get old and that Armageddon will come any day now so many aren’t prepared for retirement and old age. We weren’t prepared for grandpa dying. We were brought up, born into this religion that teaches us, brainwashed us that we won’t have to worry about any of those things. It was a shock. And the events surrounding his death were also
A shock.
